ovdesc.p: This table contains company level default values that must be set up for the Securities module to run correctly.
These defaults will apply irrespective of the application, transaction type, or user. One record must be created for each company running the Securities module.

desc.p: This field should be used to specify whether the commission plus commission tax should be shown as a separate accounting entry in the customer account. This 'split' applies only to the accounting generated from ENTITLEMENT.

Multi-valued numeric field associated with the BULK.TRANSACT field. Allows the user to define the maximum number of portfolios on a SEC.TRADE using the transaction code in the associated BULK.TRANSACT field before bulk processing is invoked to write to disk.
Input must be numeric.
Input only allowed if something has been input in the
associated BULK.TRANSACT field.
This field defines the rounding factor to be used for calculating the deal amount on which Cantonal tax will be calculated.

Example: If a SEC.TRADE on a bond is done where the gross amount of the trade was CHF1000 and the interest amount was CHF45. Assuming that the user had extered 1000 in this field then the total deal amount of CHF1045 would be rounded up to CHF2000 before the Cantonal tax rate was applied.
0 - 10 Numeric characters (Optional input)
This field controls the running of the close of business job SC.EOD.EXCEPTION.LOG. Unless this field is set to YES the job will not run.

The valuation application is used to define routines called to evaluate, modify and enter selected portfolio positions in the SC.POS.ASSET file. This field specifies the module code for which the associated routines are intended. This forms a multivalue set with fields USR.PORT.SEL.RTN and USR.POS.RTN.

Purpose - These user defined routines are intended to give the flexibility to include or exclude contracts from a particular portfolio when updating the SC.POS.ASSET file for valuation purpose. In order to amend or make changes to the SC.POS.ASSET file, the user defined routines will be called from existing routines.
USR.PORT.SEL.RTN routine will be invoked just prior standard search of customer contracts which are included in portfolio.

USR.POS.RTN routine will be invoked just prior to the write statement on SC.POS.ASSET. The routine is passed the record of the SC.POS.ASSET after processing in the calling routine and just before the updating the SC.POS.ASSET file, the user can make the modifications to this record to his requirement and pass back the array to the calling routine. So the changes can be reflected in the SC.POS.ASSET file.

If the VAL.APPL is SC then the USR.POS.RTN routine is passed the record of SC.POS.ASSET, after processing in the calling routine and just before the updating the SC.POS.ASSET file. But this routine doesnt overwrite the value calculated by the System.
The USR.PORT.SEL.RTN routine is not triggered for SC application.
2 alpha character Module Code. Input must be one of the following
AC, FD, FR, FX, DP(Deposits), MD, LC, RP,SW,SC (Optional input)

If a portfolio is not entered on the transaction then the system will assign a default depending on the application supplying the data and this being in this field and also ensuring the customer is also a Securities customer.
Example If customer number 123456 has two portfolios, 123456-1 and 123456-2, and they do a FOREX trade in which the PORTFOLIO.NUMBER field is left blank then

SC.CLASS.TYPE and EB.CLASS.NO are used to formulate the class mapping between SC internal class and EB.MESSAGE.CLASS. The main driving concept of ACTIVITY and CLASS has lend itself to facilitate the user by automatically trigger only the message related to the operation, which user are currently do. In a sense, the system will try to default a sensible CLASS tiding to corresponding activity, and populate the information on the SC transaction. Consequently, the user can take control of the class to choose whether he/she wants to produce as per suggestion by the system.
The following types are valid types:
+ BASIC.MESSAGE
+ NEW.MESSAGE
+ MODIFICATION
+ CANCELLATION
+ USER.DEFINE1
+ USER.DEFINE2
+ USER.DEFINE9
NEW.MESSAGE will be triggered for new SEC.OPEN.ORDER where CONFIRMATION is set to YES
MODIFICATION will be triggered If there is a change in AMT.TO.BROKER field between R.NEW and R.OLD of SEC.OPEN.ORDER
CANCELLATION will be triggered when SEC.OPEN.ORDER is reversed or BROKER is deleted from SEC.OPEN.ORDER
If message class needs to be triggered irrespective of any condition then, message BASIC.MESSAGE and USER.DEFINE1 to USER.DEFINE9 will be used.
Only the following values are allowed
BASIC.MESSAGE
NEW.MESSAGE
MODIFICATION
CANCELLATION
USER.DEFINE1
USER.DEFINE2
USER.DEFINE3
USER.DEFINE4
USER.DEFINE5
USER.DEFINE6
USER.DEFINE7
USER.DEFINE8

This field allows the NAV to be recorded either NET or GROSS of transaction costs.

If NET is selected then,the cost of the acquisition is NAV plus all charges and commissions,

If GROSS is selected then charges and commissions are ignored.
The difference between the cost of acquisition and sale consideration is considered as the Capital gain and taxed accordingly.
